description: An intersection of two B\u00e9zier triangles.

___intersections.description: List of info describing curved polygon(s) in the intersection.

$eref.description: A description of a curved polygon that has occurred as an intersection between two B\u00e9zier triangles. The curved polygon edges will be described in terms of the two triangles they intersect. A curved polygon can be completely described from its edges and each edge will be given as a segment from an edge of one of the two intersected triangles.

___end_params.description: Numerical parameters (along an edge of a triangle) that define the end / terminal points of each edge of the curved polygon (as segments within an edge of one of the two triangles).

items.description: A parameter as a numerical value.

___end_param_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``end_params`` (if applicable).

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is a root of ``4 s^3 + 3 s^2 + 2 s - 1 = 0`` (i.e. ``0x1.37c9dbcbb1d1cp-2``) then the polynomial is represented as ``[-1, 2, 3, 4]``.

___edge_list.description: List of integers in {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5} identifying each edge (from the original triangles) that define the curved polygon.

items.description: A ``hybrid'' index. The values {0, 1, 2} indicate an edge on the first triangle and the values {3, 4, 5} indicate an edge on the second triangle.

___start_params.description: Numerical parameters (along an edge of a triangle) that define the starting points of each edge of the curved polygon (as segments within an edge of one of the two triangles).

items.description: A parameter as a numerical value.

___nodes.description: A list of x-y coordinates of the ``corners'' of the curved polygon.

items.description: An x-y coordinate pair for a single corner.
A coordinate as a numerical value.

___start_param_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``start_params`` (if applicable).

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is a root of ``4 s^4 + 3 s - 2 = 0`` (i.e. ``0x1.182547769d3bbp-1``) then the polynomial is represented as ``[-2, 3, 0, 0, 4]``.

Either a curved polygon that occurs within the triangle-triangle intersection or a boolean. If a boolean, `true` indicates that the intersection is the first triangle (i.e. it's fully contained in the second) and `false` indicates that the intersection is the second triangle.

___triangle1.description: ID of the first triangle in the intersection.

___triangle2.description: ID of the second triangle in the intersection.
